title: Trump Said He Wouldn’t Touch the East Wing. Then He Tore It All Down.
summary: President Trump initially said the ballroom construction would not affect the East Wing. The White House now says it was cheaper and more structurally sound to simply demolish it.

title: The White House Wrecking Ball
summary: President Trump’s demolition of the East Wing has struck a nerve in Washington and beyond.

title: Mamdani Plans to Keep Tisch as Police Commissioner if Elected NYC Mayor
summary: Zohran Mamdani’s intention to retain Jessica Tisch is likely to placate powerful New Yorkers who have lobbied Mr. Mamdani to keep her.

title: University of Virginia Makes Deal With White House to Halt Investigations
summary: The Justice Department had been scrutinizing one of the nation’s premier public universities over accusations of civil rights violations.

title: Pentagon Announces ‘Next Generation’ Press Corps
summary: The Defense Department said that dozens of new reporters had agreed to sign the Pentagon’s rules on reporting, which have been rejected by many major news organizations.

title: As Shutdown Drags and Trump Flexes, Congress Cedes Its Relevance
summary: “It’s like we have given up,” one Republican lawmaker said.

title: As Johnson Delays, Grijalva Sues to Be Sworn In to Congress
summary: Representative-elect Adelita Grijalva, Democrat of Arizona, along with the state’s attorney general, argued that the speaker had no authority to delay swearing her into office.

title: Testosterone Is Giving Women Back Their Sex Drive but Risks Side Effects
summary: There is no F.D.A.-approved testosterone product for women. Insurance won’t cover it. Many doctors won’t prescribe it. It’s become a cultural phenomenon.

title: U.S. Strikes Boat in Pacific, Expanding Operation Against Drug Running Suspects
summary: It was the eighth known strike, and the first outside the Caribbean, in the Trump administration’s campaign against what it says are boats carrying drugs bound for the United States.

title: Drug-Smuggling Submarines on Display at Latin American Naval Base
summary: A display of confiscated vessels at a naval base in Ecuador offers a peek at why drug smuggling is so hard to stop.

title: Trump Said Black Chicagoans Wanted His ‘Blitz.’ Many Disagree.
summary: Six weeks into the federal crackdown in Chicago, the attack on crime that the president promised hasn’t happened, and many in the city’s Black population haven’t been won over.

title: Federal Agents Head to San Francisco Bay Area for Planned Immigration Crackdown
summary: U.S. Customs and Border Protection agents are being sent to a U.S. Coast Guard base in Alameda, Calif., ahead of an immigration operation in the San Francisco region.

title: The U.S. Struggles to Break Out From China’s Grip on Rare Earths
summary: The Trump administration is trying an array of unconventional measures to shore up U.S. rare earths supplies. It remains uncertain whether the strategy will work.

title: Three Offers in One Month: Paramount’s Secret Pursuit of Warner Bros. Discovery
summary: A letter from Paramount’s chief executive, David Ellison, to Warner Bros.’ board of directors reveals weeks of talks between the companies.

title: At a Mass Burial in Gaza, Palestinians Mourn the Unknown Dead
summary: Under the terms of a cease-fire deal, Israel and Hamas have been exchanging remains, but Gaza’s medical authorities have not been able to identify many of them.

title: I.C.J. Tells Israel to Facilitate Aid to Gaza
summary: The International Court of Justice said Israel must work with U.N. agencies, including UNRWA, the group for Palestinian refugees, which Israel has banned.

title: Why King Charles Has Not Yet Removed Andrew’s Most Valued Title: Prince
summary: New disclosures about Prince Andrew’s ties to the notorious sex offender Jeffrey Epstein have led to calls for further action from the king and Parliament.

title: Misty Copeland Will Take Her Final Bow
summary: The famed ballerina retires from her career with the American Ballet Theater after one final performance on Wednesday night.

title: On the Menu in New York: One Repair, Coming Right Up
summary: The state leads the country in “repair cafes,” which bring neighbors together while keeping all manner of items out of the trash.

title: Samantha Eggar, Oscar-Nominated Star of ‘The Collector,’ Dies at 86
summary: She also had leading roles in “Doctor Dolittle” with Rex Harrison, “Walk, Don’t Run” with Cary Grant and “The Molly Maguires” with Sean Connery.

title: Trump Wants the American People to Pay Him $230 Million
summary: Trump should pay a political price for his brazen corruption. Instead, he is telling American taxpayers to pay a price, directly to him.

title: Trump Revives Foreign Aid, Helping Needy Billionaires
summary: As children die for want of cheap medicines, the U.S. spends billions on Argentina — thus rescuing rich investors who made bad bets.

title: Trump Is Demolishing the Entire East Wing
summary: Also, oil prices have fallen sharply. Here’s the latest at the end of Wednesday.

title: Why Weren’t the Jewels Stolen From the Louvre Insured?
summary: Thieves snatched jewelry valued at more than $100 million, but the museum will not be compensated for the loss.

title: Soo Catwoman, ‘the Female Face of Punk,’ Is Dead at 70
summary: With a tuft of hair on either side of her shaved head and long tendrils of eyeliner swiped across her lids, she helped define a scene.

title: Cardiovascular Benefits of Wegovy Extend Beyond Weight Loss, Study Shows
summary: An analysis found that a shrinking waist size was responsible for only around a third of the cardiovascular benefits in people who took Wegovy.

title: Iceland Says It Is No Longer Mosquito-Free
summary: Iceland was one of the only mosquito-free places in the world, at least according to its records. Not anymore.
